A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Rian Johnson either didn't watch TFA or just said screw it. There is no attempt to have any sort of story continuity between the movies. He kills off major characters in order to make room for the new heroes or so that he can avoid an interesting backstory. New characters such as Admiral \"Hodor\"\, \"The Swindler\" from the pointless casino side story\, and Rose are introduced; and we are given no reason to care about any of them. Juvenile jokes\, eye-roll inducing one-liners\, and political/social statements are worked in at every opportunity. Also\, Leia can fly...\n\nThe entire 150-minute runtime can be summarized as follows: longest/lamest 5MPH chase scene in cinema history\, which ends in the same Rebel versus Empire situation we've been in since Episode IV -- except now the entire Resistance can fit aboard the Millenium Falcon. You could skip this movie and nothing changes but for a few forced character deaths. This is the first Star Wars that I wish I could unsee.
